translation.en: [radio DJ in Zulu] This is DJ Happygal on the morning drive.
translation.es: KwaZulu-Natal, te saluda una mujer feliz. Habla la DJ Happygal esta mañana.

translation.en: KZN FM 97.2 is where you'll find us, darlings.
[in English] Your daily dose of inspiration and good vibes.
translation.es: Tu dosis diaria de inspiración y buena onda.

translation.en: [in Zulu] So, make sure that you get your dancing shoes ready.
translation.es: Así que prepara tu calzado de baile porque ya se viene.

translation.en: If you haven't already signed up, tomorrow is your last chance to enter
translation.es: Si aún no te anotaste, mañana es la última oportunidad

translation.en: the fifth annual Jiva Loxion Street Dance Competition.
translation.es: de entrar a la quinta edición del concurso de baile Jiva Loxion.

translation.en: Three crews from KZN will qualify
translation.es: Solo tres grupos irán al campamento de Johannesburgo,

translation.en: to go to the Joburg bootcamp for nationals.
translation.es: Solo tres grupos irán al campamento de Johannesburgo, para los nacionales.

translation.en: So show us your Bhenga moves, your pantsula,
translation.es: Así que muestra tus pasos de Bhenga, Patsula, AmaPiano o un estilo completamente nuevo.

translation.en: your Amapiona, or come with a whole new style.
translation.es: AmaPiano o un estilo completamente nuevo.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Four times champs, Makhekhe and the Soweto Cats,
translation.es: Ya están aquí los tetracampeones Makhekhe y The Soweto Cats

translation.en: have touched down for the launch at the eRoyal tonight.
translation.es: Ya están aquí los tetracampeones Makhekhe y The Soweto Cats para el lanzamiento esta noche en el Club Royal.

translation.en: And if you are lucky, you might get a glimpse of DJ Sika tonight.
translation.es: Y si tienes suerte, quizá esta noche veas al DJ Sika.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Come on, boy!
[in Zulu] Hey, guys. You know what it is, we are the Umlazi Pushers!
translation.es: Muchachos, ya nos conocen. ¡Somos los Umlazi Pushers!

translation.en: [in Zulu] Oh, my sister, I'm getting almost 500 likes on this video of ours.
translation.es: Hermana, ya tenemos casi 500 "me gusta" en el video.

translation.en: [in English] You're gonna be late for Matrics.
Okay, did you wash my uniform?
Did you wash your uniform?
[in Zulu] Oh, my God! Really?
-[in Zulu] Are you ready, Mom? -Yes.
[sighs] Okay.
[in English] Did you wash your brother's uniform? [in Zulu] Yes, Mom.
translation.es: - ¿Lavaste el uniforme de tu hermano? - Sí.

translation.en: [in English] I'm so proud of him.
My boy is going to be the first one in this family to go to varsity.
translation.es: Mi hijo será el primero en esta familia en ir a la universidad.

translation.en: [in Zulu] I also could've gone to varsity. [in English] But somebody had to work, Ntombi.
translation.es: - Yo también podría haber ido. - Pero alguien debía trabajar.

translation.en: We all have our different paths in this life.
translation.es: Tenemos caminos diferentes en la vida.

translation.en: I'm just glad you left that nonsense of dancing behind you years ago.
translation.es: Me alegra que hace años que dejaste atrás esa tontería de bailar.

translation.en: I didn't really have a choice.
translation.es: De hecho, no tuve otra opción.

translation.en: -[Ntombi's uncle] Ntombi? -[in Zulu] Yes, Uncle!
Pass me the shifting spanner.
Thank you.
-[in English] Here's your coffee. -This pressure on this tap is so low.
translation.es: - Tu café. - Este grifo no tiene presión.

translation.en: But you've got this, Uncle, and I've got to go.
I'm not gonna come home after work. I'm gonna see Vuyiswa.
translation.es: Después del trabajo, veré a Vuyiswa.

translation.en: Be safe.
[in Zulu] Get all of it.
I love it when you work like this.
-[in English] Want to buy my CD? 10 rand. -[in Zulu] No thanks, brother.
translation.es: - ¿Quieres comprar mi disco? Diez rands. - No, gracias.

translation.en: Bro, give me my change.
You see, my brother, you're weak.
Every day this chick passes here. And you just look and say what?
translation.es: Esa chica pasa todos los días. Solo la miras, ¿y qué le dices? ¡Nada!

translation.en: [in English] You say nothing! Boy.
translation.es: Solo la miras, ¿y qué le dices? ¡Nada!

translation.en: [in Zulu] Take her out, man.
Eat nice things, like kebab.
translation.es: Vayan a comer algo rico, como kebab.

translation.en: [in English] Bill. Shut up!
[in Zulu] Okay! But keep on looking.
You'll turn into Google, boy. [laughs]
♪ Ain't nobody living out, yeah… ♪ [radio DJ in Zulu] There have been reports of…
service delivery protest action in Umlazi.
translation.es: Reportaron algunas protestas sociales por la falta de servicios en Umlazi.

translation.en: Allegations of corruption are mounting against Mayor Gumede.
translation.es: Acusan de corrupción al alcalde Gumede. NO SOMOS BASURA

translation.en: [man in Zulu] Bloody Mayor. Taking money from us, feeding his pocket.
translation.es: Maldito alcalde, se roba nuestro dinero.

translation.en: [radio DJ in English] We have a surprise this morning!
translation.es: Hoy les tenemos una gran sorpresa.

translation.en: [in Zulu] I'm talking about the founder of the Jiva Loxion Street Dance Competition,
translation.es: El fundador del concurso de baile callejero Jiva,

translation.en: the original, the one and only DJ Sika is in the studio.
translation.es: El fundador del concurso de baile callejero Jiva, el original, el único e inigualable Sika está en el estudio.

translation.en: [in English] It is going to be one of the best dance competition in Mzansi, man.
translation.es: Será uno de los mejores concursos de baile de Mzansi. ¿Qué te inspiró?

translation.en: -What inspired you? -[in Zulu] First, dance is in my blood.
translation.es: Será uno de los mejores concursos de baile de Mzansi. ¿Qué te inspiró? Tengo ritmo en la sangre.

translation.en: Dance is from the township, it's a global trendsetter.
translation.es: El baile es del barrio. Es un creador de tendencias mundial.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Sister. Sister. Please open the window, it's hot in here.
translation.es: Hermana. Hermana. Por favor, abre la ventana, hace calor.

translation.en: [DJ Sika, in English] The Jiva Loxion competition is about the youth,
translation.es: El concurso Jiva Loxion es sobre la juventud.

translation.en: that's where the dancing starts.
[in Zulu] Excuse me, driver. Turn up the volume.
translation.es: Disculpe, ¿puede subir un poco el volumen?

translation.en: [DJ Sika in Zulu] …in the townships. [in English] It starts with the youth dancing in their bedrooms,
translation.es: El baile empieza en los barrios, en la juventud, en sus casas,

translation.en: dancing in the streets, dancing at house parties,
translation.es: en las calles, bailando en fiestas.

translation.en: dancing at local taxi ranks,
translation.es: Incluso en las paradas de taxis y nadie les da la oportunidad de brillar.

translation.en: and no one ever gives them the opportunity to shine. Do you feel me?
translation.es: Incluso en las paradas de taxis y nadie les da la oportunidad de brillar. ¿Me entiendes?

translation.en: [in Zulu] I hear you. I feel you. Yeah.
[DJ Sika in English] The prizes are unreal this year.
Brand sponsorship for your crew for a year.
translation.es: Patrocinio de marca durante un año.

translation.en: A million rand check. And the title of the best street dance crew in South Africa.
translation.es: Un millón de rands y el título del mejor equipo de baile de Sudáfrica.

translation.en: [in Zulu] R1 000 000 is no joke. So do what you must…
translation.es: Un millón de rands. Así que hagan lo necesario y luchen por la corona, caballeros.

translation.en: [in English] And fight for the crown, gents. And of course, ladies.
translation.es: Así que hagan lo necesario y luchen por la corona, caballeros. Y, por supuesto, damas.

translation.en: Hey, buddy.
Feeling trapped?
Story of my life.
-Debrah, thank you. -Hmm.
[in Zulu] Tell me, do you hate me?
No!
[in English] Why're you always late, though?
Wait, Debrah, this is impossible.
Timesheet never lies.
You know I'm taking care of my entire family.
translation.es: Sabes que cuido a toda mi familia.

translation.en: Who isn't?
[in Zulu] Listen, everyone is up to here with black tax.
translation.es: Escucha, todos estamos hasta aquí por mantener a nuestras familias.

translation.en: [in English] All you need to do is to suck it up, and smile
translation.es: Así que solo debes aguantar y sonreír,

translation.en: 'cause we have a school tour coming up now.
translation.es: porque viene una escuela y debemos entretenerlos.

translation.en: We need to entertain them. Be happy, be happy, be happy, okay.
translation.es: porque viene una escuela y debemos entretenerlos. - Así que muestra alegría, ¿sí? - Sí, alegría.

translation.en: -Be happy happy. -[plastic dolphin squeals]
translation.es: - Así que muestra alegría, ¿sí? - Sí, alegría.

translation.en: Smile. More like it. Okay.
[Paul] Your show is not doing well.
-Fuck! -You need more drama,
[in Zulu] or else you'll be canceled, finished and that's that.
translation.es: o te cancelarán y ahí terminará todo.

translation.en: -[in English] Don't you have skeletons? -No.
-Drug abuse? -Really, P?
Criminal activity, crazy ex-girlfriend? Come on, give me something juicy!
translation.es: Actividad criminal, exnovia loca. ¡Vamos, dame algo jugoso!

translation.en: Yo! There's this girl I used to date back in high school.
translation.es: - ¡Oye! - ¿Sí? En la secundaria había una chica.

translation.en: Ahh! Tell me more.
Hot, nice things.
That is it! Let's get her on the show.
Hell no, P. I haven't talked to this girl in seven years.
translation.es: No, P. No hablo con ella hace siete años.

translation.en: That's even better. We'll be there, we'll catch the fire with…
translation.es: Aún mejor. Estaremos ahí. Filmaremos las chispas.

translation.en: This girl could be married for all I know, or living in another country, bro.
translation.es: Esta chica podría estar casada, por lo que sé, o en otro país.

translation.en: You're not the only person with a reality TV show.
translation.es: No eres la única persona con un reality show.

translation.en: You're not the only person. There's Khanyi Mbau, Somizi, Bonang.
translation.es: No eres la única persona con un reality show. Está Khanyi Mbau, Somizi, Bonang.

translation.en: Let me tell you.
They're killing you, dawg! You're here, they're here.
translation.es: ¡Te están matando! Tú estás aquí y ellos, aquí.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Come on, king!
Come on, king. G-O-T! Greatest. Come here, man!
translation.es: Vamos, rey. Juego de Tronos. El más grande, el mejor.

translation.en: Yes, king! Yes!
-[chanting in English] Season four, four! -Season four, season four, four, four!
That's right!
Baby.
[in Zulu] Not today, friend.
-And now? -[in English] Nathi… is in town.
translation.es: ¿Y ahora? Nathi está en la ciudad.

translation.en: -What? -As for what he wants, only God knows.
What, is he entering the competition again?
He's won it so many times. We get it. Oh, my gosh! Makhekhe, you're so amazing.
translation.es: Ya ganó muchas veces. Lo entendimos, Makhekhe, eres increíble.

translation.en: He doesn't need the cash, he doesn't need the fame.
translation.es: No necesita el dinero ni la fama.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Oh, have a break, girl, breathe. Rest. Oh!
[in Zulu] Do you think he's going to be at eRoyal tonight?
translation.es: ¿Crees que irá al Club Royal esta noche?

translation.en: [in English] Probably. I mean, it's the big weekend.
translation.es: Probablemente, es el gran fin de semana.

translation.en: It's the launch, everyone will be there. All your favorites, DJ Sika, the judges.
translation.es: Es el lanzamiento con tu DJ favorito, Sika, y el jurado.

translation.en: [in Zulu] What really matters, now, is your time.
[in English] For what?
I'm not entering. So.
Okay, maybe you can keep it at that.
As far as Nathi's concerned, you're probably going to see him tonight.
translation.es: Pero en cuanto a Nathi, probablemente lo verás hoy.

translation.en: What are you gonna say?
[in Zulu] I guess I'll be just honest, and say: listen Nathi, when you--
translation.es: Creo que seré sincera, algo como: "Mira, Nathi,

translation.en: [in English] When you disappeared on me, that really broke my heart.
translation.es: cuando desapareciste, me rompiste el corazón".

translation.en: You're not gonna say that. [in Zulu] You cannot spell imenemene without "men."
translation.es: No le dirás eso. Es un mentiroso, como todo hombre.

translation.en: [in English] And we don't show men that they hurt us. Right?
translation.es: Y a los hombres no les demostramos que nos lastimaron.

translation.en: So you're gonna have to give me something else.
translation.es: Así que debes pensar en algo más.

translation.en: Actually, Nathi…
You… are an asshole.
-There we go. -[in Zulu] Asshole and… Nathi… mean the same thing.
translation.es: - Ahora sí. - Imbécil y Nathi son sinónimos.

translation.en: [in English] Same WhatsApp group. -[in Zulu] Listen… -Yes.
-…don't forget I know you. -Okay!
[in English] Oh, I know you.
So I can see right through that fake celebrity persona of yours.
translation.es: Así que veo la verdad detrás de tu falsa personalidad de famoso.

translation.en: All right, catfish! Yes! [in Zulu] Let's not forget that all this dancing of yours,
you learned it from me.
translation.es: Yo te enseñé a bailar así.

translation.en: -Hit him where it hurts! Hmm! -Hmm!
translation.es: ¡Muy bien! ¡Golpéalo donde le duele! Por favor.

translation.en: This calls for a new dress, my friend!
[in English] A toast to you!
Boys, I'm going to walk and talk to this girl.
translation.es: Chicos, iré a hablar con esa chica.

translation.en: [in Zulu] You lost your mind?
If Mr. Ndaba was to see you chatting up that girl, I'm telling you, he'll kill you.
translation.es: Si el señor Ndaba te ve hablando con ella, te matará.

translation.en: Plus, you don't stand a chance with her.
You don't have the slightest chance, man.
Not a chance. Never!
Guys, guys!
Watch and learn. We'll see about this.
Only the brave shall conquer.
-Hey, ladies. -Hello.
So, um, are you guys entering the Jiva Loxion Competition?
[in Zulu] No, I thought about it, but I don't have a group, so…
translation.es: No, lo pensé, pero no tengo equipo, así que…

translation.en: -And you? -Yes, obviously.
As you can see the Umlazi Pushers are all together.
translation.es: Como pueden ver, los Umlazi Pushers están listos.

translation.en: You have a whole crew! Where did you learn dancing?
-What? -Impossible.
-You underestimate me. -I've never seen you dance.
[in English] Let's do like this. If I can prove to you that I can dance, will you… give me your number?
translation.es: De acuerdo, si te demuestro que sé bailar, ¿me darías tu teléfono?

translation.en: [in Zulu] I'll think about it.
Show me what you've got.
[in English] All right.
[in Zulu] Now that you've seen my moves, are you going to give me your number?
translation.es: Ahora que has visto mis pasos, ¿me darás tu número?

translation.en: Well, you can dance. Maybe I'll see you at the competition.
translation.es: Bueno, sabes bailar. Quizá te vea en el concurso.

translation.en: Who's this now?
[Nathi in English] Back in my hood.
translation.es: Regresé a mi barrio, a mi hogar. Aquí es donde solía pasar el rato.

translation.en: You know, back home. This is where we used to hang around, dance.
translation.es: Regresé a mi barrio, a mi hogar. Aquí es donde solía pasar el rato. Aquí bailábamos en nuestros días de secundaria.

translation.en: Get lit back in our high school days, man.
translation.es: Aquí bailábamos en nuestros días de secundaria.

translation.en: Crazy, crazy, crazy times.
This is where all the cool kids used to hang around.
translation.es: Aquí venían los chicos con onda.

translation.en: All these youngsters that you see, they're following my footsteps.
translation.es: Todos estos jóvenes que ven siguen mis pasos.

translation.en: Yeah, yeah, yeah.
Aah, the Romany Cream!
-Hey, Samu! You've grown. -Aah!
You know, I'm a man now.
[in Zulu] Your bike looks great.
-[in English] The swag, dripping leakage. -Of course.
Look, we're also working on our own designs. I'm designing it, the label.
translation.es: Mira, estamos trabajando en nuestros diseños. Estos diseños son míos. Mira la etiqueta. 100 % Umlazi.

translation.en: 100% Umlazi.
translation.es: Estos diseños son míos. Mira la etiqueta. 100 % Umlazi.

translation.en: You must hook me up when done.
[in Zulu] And your pants? How much are they?
translation.es: Búsquenme cuando terminen. ¿Cuánto cuestan tus pantalones?

translation.en: [in English] Let me give you boys a quick summary.
[in Zulu] Look, guys. Made in France for 15 grand.
translation.es: - Miren, hecho en Francia por 15 mil. - ¿Qué?

translation.en: The shoes, 20k.
translation.es: - Miren, hecho en Francia por 15 mil. - ¿Qué? - Los zapatos, 20 mil. - ¡Veinte mil!

translation.en: [in English] Twenty thousand?
But this, this is a scarf. It's a brand ambassador's gift.
translation.es: Pero esta bufanda es un regalo de la marca.

translation.en: -Put us on! How do you do it? -Okay.
[in Zulu] Guys, I didn't go to varsity and waste government resources
translation.es: Muchachos, no fui a la universidad a desperdiciar recursos del gobierno

translation.en: and waste my parents' money to get an education.
translation.es: Muchachos, no fui a la universidad a desperdiciar recursos del gobierno y el dinero de mis padres.

translation.en: [in English] I went to the university of life.
translation.es: Fui a la universidad de la vida.

translation.en: -I'm a proud graduate of the streets. -That's all?
[in Zulu] Don't get me wrong, guys. [in English] I'm not saying, don't go to school.
translation.es: Pero no me malinterpreten, muchachos. No digo que no estudien.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Go to school, and get the education, guys.
translation.es: Vayan a la escuela y estudien.

translation.en: [in English] All I'm saying is education is not the only key to success.
translation.es: Pero sepan que la educación no es la única clave del éxito.

translation.en: I want you all to be good role models to the next generation of Skhothane.
translation.es: Sean buenos modelos para la próxima generación del Skhothane.

translation.en: -Yes! -[in Zulu] Do not abuse women.
translation.es: ¡Sí! No abusen de las mujeres. Y no consuman drogas, ¿sí?

translation.en: [in English] Do not do drugs, yes? [in Zulu] Umlazi Pushers, all about love!
translation.es: No abusen de las mujeres. Y no consuman drogas, ¿sí? Umlazi Pushers. ¡Puro amor!

translation.en: -Love! Skhothanes! -Thank you!
Makhekhe, the man!
[in English] Your sister, how's she doing?
Ah, you know, same old, same old. Still uncool.
translation.es: Ya sabes, igual que siempre. Sigue sin onda.

translation.en: [chuckles] Come on. Can I pass by your house, just to say hi?
translation.es: Vamos. ¿Puedo ir a tu casa a saludarlos?

translation.en: Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah.
-Can I have her number? -Sure, sure, sure, sure.
-Samu. -[in Zulu] Hey, Makhekhe, the man.
-Debrah! -[huffs]
Okay, team abort the mission, the eagle has landed. I found Ntombi. Over and out.
translation.es: Equipo, aborten la misión. Encontré a Ntombi. Cambio y fuera.

translation.en: Debrah, I'm so sorry. I had to go get medication for Mom at the pharmacy.
translation.es: Debrah, lo siento. Fui a la farmacia a buscar medicamentos para mamá.

translation.en: That doesn't look like medication to me.
Honestly!
-What's this? -First written warning.
Lunch ended 20 minutes ago, Ntombi. 20 minutes ago!
translation.es: El almuerzo terminó hace 20 minutos, Ntombi.

translation.en: At the close, you have toilet duties.
-Debrah, toilets! -Or you want something else?
-No. -Thought so.
Toilets.
[Ntombi] Hey, Vu. I'm on my way. I had the worst day.
translation.es: Oye, Vuu. Voy en camino. Tuve el peor día de todos.

translation.en: Look, I really don't want to go out tonight.
Nathi.
[in Zulu] Energy, girl. Wake up, baby.
[in English] Pick your fighter, babe. We've got Lisa, Thandiswa, and Sister Bettina!
translation.es: Elige a tu guerrera, amiga. ¡Lisa, Thandiswa o la hermana Bettina!

translation.en: [Ntombi] I told you I'm not going out.
translation.es: Ya te dije que no voy a salir.

translation.en: Hey, hey, the liver!
Look, you are beautiful,
you are young, you are Black.
And the world needs to see it. You're going to walk into a club
translation.es: Y el mundo necesita verlo. Vas a entrar a ese club

translation.en: with your gorgeous head held high.
And you're going to show Makhekhe
that he didn't break you.
Mm, girl.
Mm, I guess she is nice.
-Pick that! Yeah! -Who is she?
[in Zulu] Yes! What's your problem?
Your shirts look like tea packets. Think we're here to drink tea?
translation.es: Sus camisas parecen manteles, no vinimos de pícnic.

translation.en: What's with your pineapple shirts? Is this heaven?
translation.es: ¿Y sus camisas de piñas? ¿Es el paraíso?

translation.en: -Is this a farm? -Guys, show us what you've got?
[in English] Wow! I definitely needed this.
[in Zulu] Hey, hey, guys!
[in English] I am the one and only DJ Happygal!
translation.es: ¡Soy la única e inigualable DJ Happygal!

translation.en: And you're about to get happy tonight!
translation.es: ¡Y estamos a punto de disfrutar mucho esta noche!

translation.en: That is my song! [laughing]
My two favorite girls!
You look gorgeous, man.
-[in Zulu] Thank you, Ma. -[in English] How's bra Joe?
He's good. [laughs]
Say hi to him for me. I will, definitely.
translation.es: - Salúdalo de mi parte. - Claro, sin duda.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Bye, Ma, see you later.
[Menzi in Zulu] Oh, yes! Vuvu, you're hot, girl.
[in English] Oh, my God!
What? You're still mad at me?
[in Zulu] Why don't you give him a chance? [in English] Who? Menzi? Come on. He doesn't have the Range,
translation.es: - ¿Por qué no le das una oportunidad? - ¿Qué, a Menzi? No tiene lo necesario.

translation.en: or the Rover.
We'll have what they're having.
[in Zulu] You know?
[in English] There's no man more single than a married one.
translation.es: No hay hombre más soltero que uno casado.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Indeed, friend. Thirst!
[in English] Why does Zinhle do this here? She's too good for it.
translation.es: Zinhle es demasiado buena para eso.

translation.en: Maybe when we were 16, 17, [in Zulu] but now, forget it.
translation.es: Quizá cuando teníamos 16 o 17, pero ¿ahora? Olvídalo.

translation.en: [man 2 in English] What do we have here? You want a drink?
Yeah, sure.
[Ntombi] I'm going to the ladies.
[in Zulu] Wait a sec.
[in English] How about you go back to your table, and then I'll get myself a drink.
translation.es: ¿Qué tal si vuelves a tu mesa y yo espero el trago?

translation.en: [barman in Zulu] What are you having?
[in English] Water, tap water, okay?
I missed you.
I think this is where you tell me you missed me.
translation.es: Aquí es cuando me dices que tú también.

translation.en: Oh, come on! Really? After seven years. This is you?
translation.es: Por favor. ¿En serio? Después de siete años, ¿qué esperas?

translation.en: Just magically making your way back into my friend's life, trying to finesse her.
translation.es: ¿Regresar mágicamente a la vida de mi amiga y reconquistarla?

translation.en: Ha! It's the audacity for me.
V, V, V, you're still feisty as ever.
translation.es: Vaya, Vee. Sigues igual de combativa que siempre.

translation.en: Look, you can try the superstar act elsewhere.
translation.es: ¡Ya basta! Puedes jugar a la superestrella en otro lado.

translation.en: But this woman here, is done with you.
translation.es: Pero esta mujer ya se cansó de ti.

translation.en: All right.
Okay.
Go and have some self-respect. My gosh! Bye!
translation.es: Ten un poco de amor propio, cielos. Adiós.

translation.en: [in Zulu] You suck!
You have no shame.
[in English] Don't make that face. What was that about?
translation.es: No pongas esa cara. ¿Qué fue eso?

translation.en: Babe, I had it under control.
Okay. Have a sip.
You're going to put a beautiful smile on that face.
Chest out, butt out.
-We're going to slay, okay? -That's definitely what we're gonna do.
translation.es: - Vamos a divertirnos. - Sí, claro que sí. Por supuesto.

translation.en: You had one job.
[in Zulu] You think I joke.
You exaggerate sometimes in all your stories.
translation.es: A veces exageras en todas tus historias.

translation.en: They called me on stage, and said I must perform a solo.
translation.es: Me llamaron al escenario para hacer un solo.

translation.en: -[laughing] -Zila.
[in English] These kids… if they want to know how to dance, they must come and ask me.
translation.es: Los niños de hoy, si quieren bailar, deben venir a preguntarme.

translation.en: [Madlamini in Zulu] You're something else.
[Uncle Zo] Let's go to Pinky's.
[Madlamini in English] Every weekend we set up a dance.
translation.es: Todos los fines de semana bailamos aquí

translation.en: Right here in the garden. I prefer it that way,
translation.es: en el jardín. Prefiero eso antes que ir a un bar con silla de ruedas

translation.en: than rolling myself to some pub with a wheelchair.
translation.es: Prefiero eso antes que ir a un bar con silla de ruedas

translation.en: And have everyone stare at me.
You know what, I'm sorry.
I just pushed it a little bit too far, you know.
translation.es: Quizá me dejé llevar un poco.

translation.en: But again… I would have loved to, but hey.
translation.es: Aunque me hubiera encantado ir, pero…

translation.en: It wouldn't be the same without you.
translation.es: no sería lo mismo sin ti.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Hey, my baby. Hello, Nolwazi.
-Hello. -[clears throat, chuckles nervously]
[in Zulu] Hey, hey, Nolwazi. It's me, Samu.
[in English] Oh, hi Samu. What's up?
Ah, you know me…
just chilling. Um, actually I had my math textbook out
translation.es: Aquí, pasando el rato. De hecho, estaba con mi libro de matemáticas

translation.en: and a calculator, you know. Matric can be pretty hard. [chuckling]
translation.es: y una calculadora, ya sabes. La escuela a veces es difícil. Así que…

translation.en: Yeah, sure.
Yeah, sure. Um…
I was thinking maybe we can meet up tomorrow, and you come and study at my house with me.
translation.es: Pensaba que quizá mañana podrías venir a casa a estudiar conmigo.

translation.en: Okay, maybe.
[in Zulu] Look, I'm in a bit of a rush.
[in English] I'm going to club eRoyal for the Jiva Loxion launch party.
translation.es: Iré al Club Royal para el lanzamiento del Jiva Loxion.

translation.en: [gasps] Say what?
I-- I can meet you there. Yeah, no. We can-- we can meet up.
Um, I thought you were busy with school stuff though.
Oh, school can wait. School can wait. I mean, it's a Friday night.
translation.es: La escuela puede esperar. Es viernes por la noche.

translation.en: Of course, I can come through and come chill with you.
translation.es: Puedo salir a relajarme contigo. Sí…

translation.en: [chuckles] Yeah! Maybe we can dance like we danced at the beach earlier.
translation.es: Puedo salir a relajarme contigo. Sí… Y quizá podemos bailar como bailamos en la playa.

translation.en: Okay, cool. I guess I'll see you soon.
[chuckles] See you soon.
Yes, boy! [chuckles] Okay.
[in Zulu] Combination is communicating.
-Oh! -I don't think so.
Oh, okay, do you want to see my ID? It's fine, it's fine. Just-- just say it.
translation.es: Está bien. ¿Quieres ver mi identificación? Está bien. Un momento.

translation.en: Ah! I think I left it at home. My own home.
translation.es: Creo que la dejé en casa. En mi propia casa.

translation.en: The one that I own, because I am 30.
I know your father.
What?
Out!
-[in Zulu] Okay fine. Don't touch me. -Go ahead, sir.
[in English] Oh, yes!
Samu!
-[in Zulu] Hey, Uncle. -Where are you going, boy?
I'm going to the Jiva Loxion launch party.
translation.es: Iré a la fiesta de lanzamiento del Jiva Loxion.

translation.en: At this hour?
Uncle, you know such parties happen at night.
translation.es: Tío, sabes que esas fiestas son de noche.

translation.en: Samukelo, you're doing matric, my boy.
[in English] This is the most important year of your life. I think you must study.
translation.es: Este es el año más importante de tu vida. Creo que debes estudiar.

translation.en: [in Zulu] No, Uncle.
Relax about studying. You see… [in English] Education…
translation.es: Relájate con el estudio. La educación no es la única clave del éxito.

translation.en: is not the only key to success.
translation.es: La educación no es la única clave del éxito.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Samu, listen to me.
You see… [in English] As long as you live under this roof,
translation.es: Verás, mientras vivan bajo este techo,

translation.en: [in Zulu] you'll live by my rules.
[in English] You're going to sit down, and study. Yes?
This is not even your house.
translation.es: Pero ni siquiera es tu casa.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Excuse me?
[in English] I thought as much.
Study! Samu.
[in Zulu] Boy, today's the day. Are you making a move?
translation.es: Amigo, escucha. Hoy es el día. ¿Darás el primer paso?

translation.en: No, Mpilo, you know I just came
translation.es: No, Mpilo, sabes que solo vine a darle mi CD a Sika.

translation.en: to give DJ Sika my CD, and not here for girls.
translation.es: No, Mpilo, sabes que solo vine a darle mi CD a Sika. No vine por una chica.

translation.en: Boy, there he is. Go and give him your CD, superstar.
translation.es: Ahí está, muchacho. Ve y dale tu disco, superestrella. Vamos.

translation.en: [in English] Maybe today isn't a good time to give him the CD.
translation.es: Quizá hoy no sea un buen momento.

translation.en: Sika's always talking about you.
Every single night when I was a little boy, I'd sneak into this club.
translation.es: De niño, todas las noches entraba aquí a escondidas.

translation.en: And guess who'd kick me out.
Every time, you'd sneak back in.
-[in Zulu] He was naughty, wasn't he? -Hey!
[in English] Thank you for having us. After you, my love.
Hi.
[in Zulu] Out. Now.
[DJ in Zulu] Party people, make some noise, make some noise!
translation.es: Fiesteros, reciban con un gran aplauso…

translation.en: [in Zulu] No, no, no! Are you crazy?
[in English] I want you to do the right thing. And yes, the baby is yours!
translation.es: Quiero que hagas lo correcto. Y sí, el bebé es tuyo.

translation.en: [DJ] The founder and the host of Jiva Loxion Dance Competition!
translation.es: …al fundador y anfitrión del concurso de baile Jiva Loxion.

translation.en: -You can't win, you know my wife! -[DJ Happygal] None other than…
translation.es: Si te acercas a mí o a mi esposa,

translation.en: I'll file a restraining order against you.
-…DJ Jika-Jika. -Don't threaten me!
[in Zulu] Do you hear me?
[DJ Happygal in English] I'm talking about Mr. Platinum Live
translation.es: Con ustedes, el señor Vida de Platino.

translation.en: DJ Sika!
Come on, make some noise! Make some noise!
Party people, where you at?
[in Zulu] It's good to be here.
[in English] That's what I'm talking about.
Over the next couple of weeks,
you will cry, you will sweat,
and you will dance for your lives.
And in the end, only three groups will be named the Jiva Loxion champions!
translation.es: Pero al final, solo tres equipos serán los campeones del Jiva Loxion.

translation.en: Now, I will be deciding your fate
translation.es: Yo decidiré su destino, junto con la legendaria fundadora

translation.en: alongside the legendary founder of Club eRoyal,
translation.es: Yo decidiré su destino, junto con la legendaria fundadora del Club Royal, ¡la señorita Thandi-D!

translation.en: Miss Thandi-D!
And of course not forgetting the queen of SA Jiva,
translation.es: Y, por supuesto, no olvidemos a la reina del Jiva sudafricano.

translation.en: the bodacious, the ever so beautiful, Ms. Bontle Modisele!
translation.es: La increíble, la hermosa, ¡la señora Bontle Modisele!

translation.en: God, she is insane!
I know.
[DJ Sika] Yeah, yeah! As you can see,
translation.es: ¡Muy bien! Como pueden ver, el DJ Sika siempre les trae lo mejor de lo mejor.

translation.en: DJ Sika always provides you with the best of the best,
translation.es: Como pueden ver, el DJ Sika siempre les trae lo mejor de lo mejor.

translation.en: and there'll be more surprises as the night goes by. But for now,
translation.es: Y habrá más sorpresas esta noche. Pero ahora, quisiera presentarles a los últimos campeones del Jiva Loxion.

translation.en: I'd like to introduce last year's Jiva Loxion champions.
translation.es: Pero ahora, quisiera presentarles a los últimos campeones del Jiva Loxion.

translation.en: Durban, please make some noise
translation.es: Durban, por favor, un gran aplauso

translation.en: for Soweto Cats!
[Nathi] Hey, hey, hey.
[in Zulu] I love you, okay.
[in English] When I shine, you shine. When I win, you're coming with me to Joburg.
translation.es: Cuando yo brillo, tú brillas. Cuando gane, vendrás conmigo a Jo'burg.

translation.en: [woman] If we call your number, please step forward.
translation.es: Si decimos su número, den un paso adelante.

translation.en: Right. Number four.
And number eight.
Congratulations, you're going on tour!
Thank you, thank you so much! [laughs excitedly, in Zulu] Thank you.
But he stole my life.
No! Sister, you're not going to compare yourself to Makhekhe.
translation.es: ¡No! Hermana, no te compares con Makhekhe.

translation.en: That's supposed to be me on that stage.
translation.es: Yo debería estar en ese escenario.

translation.en: [woman] Number eight, congratulations, you're going on tour!
translation.es: Número ocho. ¡Felicitaciones, se irán de gira!

translation.en: Thank you, thank you so much!
[Uncle] Ntombi!
[in Zulu] I'm sorry.
Your father.
Your mother tried to stop him, but he shot himself.
translation.es: Tu madre intentó detenerlo, pero se suicidó.

translation.en: No!
-Where's Mom? -She's in the hospital.
translation.es: ¿Dónde está mamá? Está en el hospital.

translation.en: [in Zulu] Hey. I miss you, Vuvu. [in English] And I know you miss me too.
translation.es: Te extraño, Vuvu. Y sé que tú también me extrañas.

translation.en: You know what I don't miss? I don't miss bailing you out of jail.
translation.es: ¿Sabes lo que no extraño? No extraño sacarte de la cárcel.

translation.en: -Twice. -Ahh.
[in Zulu] I don't miss giving you my money.
[in English] Your fly-by-night businesses, side hustles!
And I definitely don't miss wondering whether you're alive or not.
translation.es: Y no extraño preguntarme si seguirás vivo o no.

translation.en: [in Zulu] You were busy gallivanting with your boys!
translation.es: - ¡Siempre de fiesta con los muchachos! - No, Vuvu.

translation.en: -No! No! -Vuvu.
translation.es: - ¡Siempre de fiesta con los muchachos! - No, Vuvu. No. Eres un niño…

translation.en: [in English] You're a boy.
Not a man.
And that's why we're not together.
translation.es: Y por eso no estamos juntos.

translation.en: -Right? -Huh.
[in Zulu] Move.
Move!
[in Zulu] You all right?
Huh?
[in English] Sorry. Do you want to… do you want to dance?
I mean, whatever it is you're feeling right now,
translation.es: Lo que sea que estés sintiendo ahora no puede ser tan malo

translation.en: can't be that bad that you can't just dance, just shake it off.
translation.es: Lo que sea que estés sintiendo ahora no puede ser tan malo como para impedirte bailar y olvidarlo por un rato.

translation.en: Just dance it off, just dance it off, [in Zulu] what do you think?
translation.es: y olvidarlo por un rato. Solo baila para olvidarlo. ¿Qué te parece?

translation.en: [in English] Please leave me alone.
Please, take me home.
-Now? -[in Zulu] Now!
-[in English] But we just-- -[in Zulu] Vuyiswa, let's go!
[in English] Fine. No one's fighting you!
Oh, my God, it's Makhekhe and the Cats!
Subtitle translation by Mulalo Mavhungu
